Deaths

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
12613 Death statistics

Definition:
Deaths of earlier years (war deaths), legal declarations of
death and stillbirths are not included.
In death statistics, the life span of babies who died is
broken down further. Those children who died before their
first birthday are shown under "deaths of children in their
1st year of life". Those of the children who died within 7
days of their birth are shown under "deaths of children in
their first 7 days of life".

Stillbirths (birth statistics) are not regarded as deaths
but as births. These are newborns with a minimum body weight
of 500 g whose heart has not beaten, whose umbilical cord
has not pulsed and whose natural lung respiration has not
commenced after separation from the mothers body.
From 1 July 1979 to 31 March 1994 the weight limit was 1,000
g. Before 1 July 1979, a minimum body length of 35 cm was
used to distinguish between live births and stillbirths.
